alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, south central Pender, northeastern Brunswick and eastern Columbus Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Batarora, or 12 miles west of Leland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, Bishop, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Masonboro, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Phoenix, Ogden, Winnabow, Mayfaire, Wrightsboro, Batarora, Mill Creek, Town Creek and Silver Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 412 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 32 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
